RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GROOVIN' IS BAK broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the backstretch, maintained her advantage while saving ground through the final turn, and held sway while never seriously threatened. BARBERRY BANDIT stalked the leader from along the rail entering the backstretch, launched his bid from along the inside entering the final turn, shifted off the rail leaving the turn, and closed willingly two wide in the drive to prove clearly second best. C C SUNRISE away alertly and tracked the leader in the run down the backside while racing between rivals, rallied two wide through the final turn, and finished three wide in the drive to garner a share. TEXAS LEGACY away well and stalked the leader in the run down the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but was unable to make a serious late impact while finishing five wide in the drive. DARLA'S FURY settled at the back of a compact field while racing three wide entering the backside, trailed the field into the final turn while racing two wide , and found her best stride late while unable to threaten.

ENTRY.NAME: Barberry Bandit
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Groovin' Is Bak
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, held

ENTRY.NAME: Texas Legacy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: C C Sunrise
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Darla's Fury
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 5 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 57. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 22 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 22 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Pri ce $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. 3 Year olds Claiming $6,000 (BC Bred $7500). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TOBESUNNY broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, and widened her advantage through the lane under confident handling. PERFECT PENNY away well and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied smartly two wide through the final turn, was no match for the winner in the drive, but finishing willingly from along the rail to prove second best. STRIKING VALUE hesitated at the start to get away slowly, raced into a stalking trip one out from the rail entering the backside, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, and finished evenly from along the rail in the drive to garner a share. DRILL BABY DRILL away alertly and was allowed to settle off the early pace while racing two wide in the run down the backstretch, saved ground through the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. LIL'MISS INTAGLIO settled at the back of the pack entering the backside while saving ground at the rail, was always well back and failed to make an impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Perfect Penny
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 w, rallied 2 w, closed rail, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Lil'miss Intaglio
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Striking Value
ENTRY.COMMENT: hesitated start, stalked 2 wide, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Tobesunny
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, widened

ENTRY.NAME: Drill Baby Drill
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, settled 2 wide, rallied inside, needed more

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 50. Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BEST ONE YET stalked the contested early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied smartly along the inside entering the final turn, tipped three wide for the drive, took control soon after entering the lane and quickly drew clear. SWEET AS HONEY away well, and was allowed to settle off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, saved ground while racing through the final turn, and closed determinedly four wide in the drive to get up for the place. SHE'S ON FIRE was off a step slow, but rushed up to force the issue two wide entering the first turn, continued to pressed the pacesetter two wide in the run down the backside, took a narrow advantage into the final turn, but was outfinished in the stretch drive. LILSISTERLEE away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, but faded in the stretch drive. CLASSY LEGACY broke sharply and stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet as Honey
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled rail, rallied inside, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: She's On Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Classy Legacy
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Lilsisterlee
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Best One Yet
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, rallied rail, closed 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 62. Claiming Purse 10000. (PLUS UP TO $5,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED AT THE 2023 MEET AND HAVE NOT FINISHED 1ST, 2ND OR 3RD AT THE CURRENT MEET. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. (Horse s that win this condition are no longer eligible for this condition while all other starters in this condition remain eligible.)(Winning this race will not be considered in eligibility in any other condition maidens excluded). British Columbia Bred Claimi ng Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ANOTHER GUINNESS away well and tracked the leader in the run down the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied smartly from along the inside entering the final turn, and closed determinedly from along the rail in the lane to get up in the final strides. TIZ MEOW stalked the pacesetter into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and closed gamely three wide in the drive to just miss. IT'S IN COMMAND broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the backstretch, dictated the pace in the run down the backside and through the final turn, and closed two wide in the drive, but faded in deep stretch. VANCOUVER'S HUNTER settled off the early pace while racing two wide in the run down the backstretch, rallied three out from the rail entering the final turn, and finished five wide in the drive. TIMELESS SHRUG unhurried early and trailed the field into the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive but was unable to mount a serious late bid. ACE DEUCE away alertly and stalked the leader in the run down the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but failed to respond when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Tiz Meow
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Vancouver's Hunter
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Another Guinness
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2w, rallied inside, closed rail, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: It's in Command
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide, late fade

ENTRY.NAME: Ace Deuce
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Timeless Shrug
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, closed rail

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 62. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At a Mile or Over Since June 22 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 , For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. 3 Year olds Claiming $6,000 (BC Bred $7500). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DYNAMITER away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace through the second turn and into the backstretch, opened a clear lead in the run to the final turn, maintained his advantage into the lane, and held SILVER ARROW safely at bay to prove best. SILVER ARROW settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail through the stretch the first time, began to improve her position in the run to the final turn, rallied smartly from along the rail entering the final turn, and closed willingly from along the rail in the drive to get up for the place. SILARONE unhurried early while trailing the field into the lane the first time, began to advanced four wide upon entering the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished four wide in the drive to garner a share. TUXEDO broke sharply and stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, launched his bid two wide entering the final turn, but was unable to sustain his bid in the lane while fading late. EH TEE EM settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail through the stretch the first time, dropped back to trail in the run to the final turn, and needed more when called upon. BLACKSTONE tracked the leader through the lane the first time while racing one out from the rail, struggled to keep tabs on the pacesetter in the run to the final turn, and weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Silarone
ENTRY.OWNER: Rycroft Cathy Rycroft Kelly Dale Dennis Perry Tabitha and Benson Sheryle
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, advanced 1/2, rallied 3w, closed 4 wide

ENTRY.NAME: Tuxedo
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked rail, rallied 2 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Eh Tee Em
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Silver Arrow
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Dynamiter
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, clear lead, held

ENTRY.NAME: Blackstone
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, weakened 1/4

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 58. Maiden Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $7,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHI CHI'S SONG broke sharply and dueled for the lead one out from the rail entering the first turn, before easing into a tracking trip entering the backstretch, launched her bid two wide entering the final turn, took control in mid stretch and quickly drew clear. B C CHU CHU hopped at the start, but chased the leaders three wide entering the first turn and took a narrow advantage three wide entering the backstretch, maintained her advantage through the final turn, began to tire in mid stretch, and steadied slightly off heels, but managed to hold the place. PETERSON LANDING away well and stalked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and finished three out from the rail in the drive to get up for a share. MS. STANFORD away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, chased the pacesetter from along the rail in the run down the backside and into the final turn, but was outfinished in the late stages. HIGHER IMAGE unhurried early while trailing the field into the first turn, bided her time at the back of the pack in the run down the backstretch, and failed to mount a serious late bid when called upon. The stewards conducted a review of the stretch run following the running of this race, but after review made no change to the original order of finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Higher Image
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Peterson Landing
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked inside, rallied inside, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Ms. Stanford
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: B C Chu Chu
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Danard Sue
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped start, led 2 wide, checked 1/16, held place

ENTRY.NAME: Chi Chi's Song
ENTRY.OWNER: Forster Stable and Blue Willow Dairy Ltd
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled 2w, rallied 2w, closed 3w, best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 22 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 8 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A R ace Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DON WITH THE WIND broke sharply and raced to the lead from along rail entering the first turn and maintained that lead through the second turn and in the run down the backside, held a clear advantage into the lane and held LIZZIES GIRL safely at bay late to prove best. LIZZIES GIRL stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, maintained her position in the run down the backside while well in hand, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, tipped two wide from the drive and closed gamely to prove clearly second best. PADDY D'ORO away alertly and tracked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, continued to track the pacesetter two wide in the run down the backside, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response in the drive while holding on for a share. BODEGA unhurried early while dropping back to trail entering the stretch the first time, continued to bide his time at the back of the field in the run down the backstretch, rallied smartly from along the rail entering the final turn, and found his best stride late while closing at the rail in the stretch drive. JUST MAKE BELIEVE away well and stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, maintained his position in the run down the backstretch while being held three wide, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. YOU DON'T OWN ME stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, continued with a wide trip throughout, and failed to make a late impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Lizzies Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Bodega
ENTRY.OWNER: Snow Roger E and Doyle Maurice
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Paddy d'Oro
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Just Make Believe
ENTRY.OWNER: Last Call Racing Stable and Bornn Cathy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Don With the Wind
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, held

ENTRY.NAME: You Don't Own Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, needed more

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 8 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 52. Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MOUNT LOKI settled off the early leaders while racing mid pack through the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, launched his bid two wide entering the final turn, shifted three wide entering the lane, and got up in deep stretch to prove best. DEANARROW stalked the early pace while racing one out from the rail through the stretch the first time, tipped four wide entering the backstretch and rushed up to force the issue in the run to the final turn, battled from the outside of SOMTHING ELUSIVE through the final turn, took a narrow advantage into the lane, but was unable to fend off a late surge by MOUNT LOKI in the closing strides. SOMTHING ELUSIVE broke sharply and tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, angled off the rail entering the backstretch to force the issue three wide from between rivals in the run to the final turn, battled through the final turn from the inside of DEANARROW, but was outfinished late while proving best of the rest. DAPPER DON settled well off the early pace while saving ground at the rail through the stretch the first time, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished two wide in the drive while improving his position late. UNION MAN away well and dueled for the lead from the outside of SHOWMAN through the stretch the first time, struggled to hold his position in the run to the final turn, raced two wide into the turn, but faded in the late going. HARBOUR STORM unhurried early while dropping back to trail, bided her time at the back of the pack while racing four wide in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but failed to make a late impact. SHOWMAN away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, set a pressured pace from along the rail into the backstretch, began to drop back approaching the final turn, and had nothing to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Harbour Storm
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Stajkowski Neil Sutherland June Hickman Barry and Miller Charlene
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 2 wide, never menaced

ENTRY.NAME: Dapper Don
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Showman
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Mount Loki
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 2w, closed 3w, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Union Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Somthing Elusive
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked inside, pressed 3w, rallied inside

ENTRY.NAME: Deanarrow
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2w, pressed 4w, rallied 2w, led, closed 2 wide,
